segments.text: Every day, developers and engineers
build new AI tools and AI projects. And
in this weekly project update video, we
cover top trending AI tools and
projects. These projects focus on
productivity, automation, privacy, and
real workflows that you can actually
use. Without wasting time, let's get
started. Project number one, SLED. Voice
control for your coding agents. SLED is
a voice first AI agent layer that turns
your phone into a remote control for
coding assistance running on your own
computer. You speak a task, SLED
transcribes it, then securely routes it
to tools like Claude Code, OpenAI
Codeex, or Gemini CLI on your local
machine, so your code stays private. It
sends the agents progress and results
back to your phone, including spoken
responses, so you can review changes,
summaries, or test outcomes while away
from your desk. This matters right now
because it blends real automation with
hands-free workflow orchestration and
safe local execution. Give it a run and
watch automation unfold in real time.
Project number two, Colloquio Private on
Device. A I Companion. Colloquio is an
AI companion app that runs entirely on
your device without sending anything to
the cloud. So your conversations and
memories stay private on your phone. It
downloads a local AI model once, then
works offline with no internet
connection required and keeps context
and preferences in memory, so it feels
natural and personal as you chat.
Colloquio does all its processing on
your device, which avoids a PI costs and
protects your data, and it even supports
remembering your name, nicknames, and
topics you care about. The app does not
require an account and focuses on quick
questions, brainstorming, or thoughtful
conversation wherever you are, even
without data. Give it a run and watch
automation unfold in real time. Project
number three, Binary. AI assisted hiring
and applicant tracking. Binary is a
modern ATS that uses AI to make hiring
faster, simpler, and more efficient for
startups and growing teams. It lets you
create engaging application forms and
then uses an AI assistant to pre-tag and
review candidates so you spend less time
reading every resume. Binary shows
applications super fast, offers tools
like video questions and keyboard
shortcuts, and helps you send replies
directly from the platform. All data is
encrypted in transit and at rest. And
the product aims to keep your
information secure while giving you
insights quickly. Binary is for
founders, recruiters, and HR teams who
want to streamline hiring with AI
support. Project number four, Natto
invisible A I notes and dictation
overlay. Natto is an AI assistant that
works as an invisible overlay across
your desktop so you can capture notes,
dictate text, and interact with AI
without switching apps. It captures
spoken words and turns them into cleanly
formatted text anywhere you work. And it
takes detailed meeting notes instantly
while you focus on your call. The
overlay also lets you access a minimal
chat window that floats above your
screen for quick questions and it keeps
your flow uninterrupted as you stay in
the zone. Natto's design suits knowledge
workers, teams, and professionals who
want a I help without breaking their
work context and manual note-taking.
Project number five, Snaply AI ondevice
voice dictation for Mac. Snaply AI is an
AI tool for Mac OS that turns your
spoken words into typed text across any
app. So you can stop typing and just
speak. It uses local A I models on your
Mac to transcribe voice into text
instantly while keeping all your data on
your device and private. And it also
offers realtime grammar fixes, tone
adjustments, and translation into many
languages. Snaply works inside your
favorite apps, lets you speak naturally
to write faster, and helps you capture
meeting notes, emails, or documents with
minimal effort. This matters because it
speeds daily workflows, avoids cloud
processing costs, and protects your
voice data. Give it a run and watch
automation unfold in real time. Project
number six, Remo 2.0. A I personal
knowledge management hub. Ramo is an A I
knowledge management assistant that
captures, organizes, and retrieves
information so you spend less time
searching and more time working. It
builds a searchable personal knowledge
base by autocapturing web content, local
files, emails, and other data. And then
you can ask questions in natural
language to get precise answers from
your own information. Remo uses a local
first design that stores your data on
your device while still accessing large
language models for deep insights so
your private content stays secure. It
works as an integrated desktop and
browser assistant with features like
summaries, smart organization, and
intelligent search across everything you
save. Remo is for professionals,
researchers, and knowledge workers who
juggle many sources of information and
want faster clarity. Project number
seven, Vellum Enterprise. A I agent
development platform. Vellum is an AI
agent platform that lets teams build,
connect, and deploy EIA workflows and
agents using plain English or visual
tools without heavy coding. It turns
simple instructions into agents that
pull data, call tools, and automate
tasks across apps like Notion, Slack,
Google Sheets, or Salesforce, and gives
developers and teams control over every
step with built-in orchestration, SDKs,
and monitoring tools. Vellum supports
testing, evaluation, observability, and
version control. So you can refine logic
and ensure reliability before
deployment. It matters right now because
companies need safe and compliant AI
automation with governance, security,
role-based access, and flexible hosting
options. Vellum is for engineers,
product teams, and businesses who want
faster a development with visibility and
governance. Project number eight, simple
pleasant browser for PostGSQL data.
Simple is a database browser that helps
you explore and interact with your
PostGSQL data in a clear and simple
interface. You connect your database
with a standard connection string and
simple discovers your tables, columns,
and relationships. So you can browse,
search, and filter records without
writing SQL. It shows relationships and
lets you edit fields in line, view
schema diagrams, and navigate data with
smooth controls that feel satisfying and
easy to use. All database credentials
stay local and encrypted on your
machine, so sensitive information never
leaves your system, and your data
remains protected. Simple is for
developers, analysts, and small teams
who want a faster, friendlier way to
look at their data. Project number nine.
Echimoira console M cp a i access to
search console data. Echimoira console
mcp is a hosted model context protocol
server that connects Google search
console data to large language models
like claude chatgpt and cursor. So you
can ask natural language questions about
your search performance without
exporting CSVs or writing scripts. You
link your Google account and Aamura
handles the O aut and secure connection
letting you query clicks, impressions,
URL indexing, sitemap status and
property details using conversational
prompts. This bridges structured search
console a P is to AI assistance with no
local setup which matters because it
saves SEO teams time and avoids manual
data downloads. Akamoira suits SEO
professionals, marketers, and analysts
who need fast insights from GSC through
AI tools. Project number 10, Langfinity.
A EI real time business voice
translation platform. Langfinity. A I is
an A I translation platform that uses
realtime voice agents to translate
meetings and conversations across many
languages for global teams. It captures
spoken language from one person and
instantly produces accurate natural
translations so participants can hear
and understand each other without manual
interpretation. And it learns company
specific terminology and jargon to
improve translation quality over time.
Langfinity supports multi- language
meetings and works with business
conference workflows to provide
transcripts, summaries, and searchable
records of conversations. This matters
because international teams need fast,
reliable communication without language
barriers. Langfinity AI is for
businesses, event organizers, and global
teams who want multilingual
collaboration without extra steps.
Project number 11, Blockpad, real time
project management workspace. Blockpad
is a real-time project management
workspace that brings tasks,
documentation, and collaboration
together so teams can plan and execute
work without switching tools. It shows
canban boards, lists, and a wiki in one
place that updates instantly so changes
appear live for everyone without
refreshing. And contextual comments and
mentions help keep discussions tied to
work. Blockpad runs in the browser with
a fast underlying stack and superbase
real-time updates so your team stays in
sync and your data stays secure and it
avoids mid- project payw walls or
unexpected locks on your work. Blockpad
is for modern teams, founders, and
remote groups who want clear work
context and smooth collaboration.
Project number 12, known CLI, persistent
project context for a known CLI, is an
AI first command line tool that gives
your AI agents persistent memory of your
project context so you don't repeat the
same setup every session. It works as a
CLI first knowledge layer that lets the
AI read linked tasks and documentation
automatically. Resolve context like at
doc or at task references and include
this information in prompts without
manual copy paste. Known integrates with
tools such as claude code, cursor,
gemini cli and other AI assistance via
the model context protocol MCP so your
agents understand project goals and
conventions. It also includes task
management, documentation tracking,
built-in time tracking, and an optional
web UI so developers and teams keep
knowledge in sync. known matters because
it removes context friction and keeps
documentation up to date as the AI
learns. Project number 13, Alpine
Unified AI powered workspace platform.
Alpine is a team workspace that brings
docs, tasks, chat, forums, and AI
features into one connected app, so you
spend less time switching between tools
and more time focused on work. You get
fast document editing, task tracking,
contextual AI search, and a personalized
feed that surfaces relevant updates. And
Alpine uses models to improve search
results across your work so you find the
right content quickly. All your tools
live in one place with intelligent inbox
sorting and integrated AI that
understands context across docs and
tasks, which helps teams stay in sync
without extra apps. Alpine is for teams,
founders, and professionals who want
clearer collaboration with built-in AI
assistants. Project number 14, Aiden
AIE, infrastructure for profitable AI
agents. Aiden AI is an AI native
infrastructure platform that helps teams
deploy, govern, and scale autonomous
agents with real-time financial control
and operational insight. It links your
agent fleet to a shared governance layer
that tracks cost, usage, audits, and
compliance, so you know exactly where
every API call and dollar goes. And it
offers SDKs that work with popular AI
frameworks to monitor performance across
models and tool calls. Aiden provides
cost metering, autonomous spend
guardrails, audit ready traceability,
and integration tools that eliminate
billing surprises and improve
operational clarity. It matters right
now because organizations building
agentic services need predictable
economics and compliance without manual
oversight. Aiden is for engineers,
operations leaders, and businesses that
want to run AI agents with financial
certainty and governance. Project number
15, Stack Patch, CL I patches for
production, next.js
features. Stack patch is a developer CLI
that adds production ready features such
as authentication, payments, and reddus
support directly into your existing
next.js app so you don't build them from
scratch. You run simple commands like
npx stack patch add o and stack patch
auto detects your project structure,
injects clean code where needed, and
shows a file preview before applying
changes, letting you own every line. All
generated code lives in your repo and is
fully editable, so there are no blackbox
dependencies and you can customize
later. Stack patch matters because it
speeds up feature integration and
removes repetitive boilerplate for
founders and developers building web
apps. Project number 16, meeting minutes
instant a IME capture and action.
Meeting minutes is a feature within the
Manis a I workspace that captures
realworld conversations and turns them
into structured actionable outcomes with
a single tap. You start a recording of
any in-person meeting, interview, or
monologue. And Manis analyzes the audio
to produce clear summaries, identify
speakers, and extract key to-dos,
decisions, and discussion points. It
organizes this output into notes that
become living context you can use
immediately to create presentations,
websites, or social media assets without
switching tools. The processing
continues even if your internet drops,
and separate speaker names help assign
action items accurately. This feature
matters because it closes the gap
between talk and execution, turning
ideas into work that gets done for teams
and professionals. Project number 17,
Local Mark Studio, local first markdown
editor for privacy. Local Mark Studio is
a local first markdown editor that runs
in your browser and keeps your writing
private by storing everything locally
with no signup or cloud dependency. It
gives you a real file tree to create
folders and files, a command pallet for
quick actions, a split pane live
preview, and smart paste that turns rich
HTML into clean markdown. All documents
stay in your browser's indexed DB so you
can work offline and control your own
data. And you can export content as
markdown, HTML, PDF, or JS when you're
ready. It matters because many writers
and developers want a fast,
distraction-free editor without cloud
lockin. Project number 18, Flight
Follower. Add free realtime flight
tracker. Flight Follower is a flight
tracking app that shows live aircraft
positions, speed, altitude, and route
details on a fast native map for
aviation fans and plane spotters. It
uses ADSB flight data from public
sources to display nearby flights in
real time and integrates with Siri so
you can ask what plane is that and get
instant identification all without ads
or accounts. The app also provides live
notifications and home screen widgets so
you can see aircraft activity at a
glance and track planes as they move
across the sky. Flight follower matters
because it gives accurate free flight
tracking with smooth iOS interactions
built for enthusiasts. Project number
19, Stracti Noa A IBOT automation
platform. Stradi is a noode AI
automation platform that helps you build
and run intelligent bots for games and
desktop apps without writing code. It
gives you a visual editor in the browser
where you design bots that use
vision-based AI detection to see
interface elements. So they work like a
human clicking and reading the screen
instead of relying on APEs. You create,
preview, and manage your bots. across
devices with a desktop client that runs
automation locally and you get clear
action history so you know what each bot
did and why this matters because it
makes automation accessible to gamers,
hobbyists and creators who want to
automate repetitive tasks without deep
programming skill. Project number 20,
HAL 9 Generative A I platform for data
and apps. HAL 9 is a generative AI
platform that helps founders and
developers create, deploy, and scale AI
powered solutions without heavy custom
engineering. The HAL 9 platform lets you
build chat bots, APIs, apps, and agentic
workflows using flexible model agnostic
tooling that runs securely on any cloud
or infrastructure you choose and
integrates with Python and common
libraries like Langchain. You start with
easy creation and expand to embed and
customize AI features so teams get
working product logic without
reinventing core components. HAL 9 also
offers managed support to help refine
and launch your MVP quickly. This
matters because startups and teams can
go from idea to functional AI product
with clear governance and fewer
barriers. Thanks for watching. See you
in the next video.
